unnormalised: New flyover in Bengaluru faces delays! Seems like the Hosur Rd flyover project is gonna be pushed back again. They were supposed to finish by 30/06/2024, but now the latest buzz is it’ll take another 3 months, maybe even more.
normalised: New flyover in Bengaluru faces delays! Seems like the Hosur Road flyover project is going to be pushed back again. They were supposed to finish by thirtieth June two thousand and twenty four, but now the latest buzz is it will take another three months, maybe even more.

unnormalised: Apparently, the main issue is the supply of materials. Heard from a source that they’re facing a shortage of cement, and getting enough steel is also proving difficult. Plus, the monsoon season is hitting the city hard, causing even more delays. Rainfall of 150 mm last week really messed things up!
normalised: Apparently, the main issue is the supply of materials. Heard from a source that they are facing a shortage of cement, and getting enough steel is also proving difficult. Plus, the monsoon season is hitting the city hard, causing even more delays. Rainfall of one hundred and fifty millimeter last week really messed things up!

unnormalised: The initial estimate was a cost of ₹135 crores, but now folks are saying it could easily cross ₹150 cr. That’s a lot of moolah! Guess that’s what happens when timelines keep getting extended. Commuters who use Hosur Rd are already pulling their hair out.
normalised: The initial estimate was a cost of rupee one hundred and thirty five crores, but now folks are saying it could easily cross rupee one hundred and fifty crores. That's a lot of moolah! Guess that's what happens when timelines keep getting extended. Commuters who use Hosur Road are already pulling their hair out.

unnormalised: The flyover, which is meant to ease traffic congestion, is approximately 2.5 km long. They’ve already laid 1800 meters of road, but there’s still a good chunk left to go. The whole thing is built on reinforced concrete pillars that are sunk nearly 45 feet into the ground.
normalised: The flyover, which is meant to ease traffic congestion, is approximately two point five kilometer long. They have already laid one thousand eight hundred meters of road, but there is still a good chunk left to go. The whole thing is built on reinforced concrete pillars that are sunk nearly forty five feet into the ground.

unnormalised: Once complete, it will significantly cut down travel time between Silk Board and Electronic City. Let's hope they can wrap it up soon! Tired of all the traffic jams, yaar!
normalised: Once complete, it will significantly cut down travel time between Silk Board and Electronic City. Let's hope they can wrap it up soon! Tired of all the traffic jams, yaar!
